trans-unit.source: OpenID Connect 1.0 in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) enables you to use the OAuth 2.0 protocol for single sign-on.
trans-unit.target: OpenID Connect 1.0 in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) enables you to use the OAuth 2.0 protocol for single sign-on.

trans-unit.source: OAuth 2.0 is an authorization protocol, but OpenID Connect extends OAuth 2.0 for use as an authentication protocol.
trans-unit.target: OAuth 2.0 is an authorization protocol, but OpenID Connect extends OAuth 2.0 for use as an authentication protocol.

trans-unit.source: A primary feature of the OpenID Connect protocol is that it returns an <parameterReference>id_token</parameterReference>, which is used to authenticate the user.
trans-unit.target: A primary feature of the OpenID Connect protocol is that it returns an <parameterReference>id_token</parameterReference>, which is used to authenticate the user.

trans-unit.source: For more information about OpenID Connect, see the specification, <externalLink><linkText>OpenID Connect Core 1.0</linkText><linkUri>http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about OpenID Connect, see the specification, <externalLink><linkText>OpenID Connect Core 1.0</linkText><linkUri>http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Here is a sample OpenID Connect request to Azure AD:
trans-unit.target: Here is a sample OpenID Connect request to Azure AD:

trans-unit.source: In addition to the support for the <parameterReference>id_token</parameterReference> response type, we have added support for the following parameters in the request.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the support for the <parameterReference>id_token</parameterReference> response type, we have added support for the following parameters in the request.

trans-unit.source: [Required] This is value is used to protect against token replay attacks.
trans-unit.target: [Required] This is value is used to protect against token replay attacks.

trans-unit.source: The value provided in the request must match the <parameterReference>nonce</parameterReference> claim value that is returned in the <parameterReference>id_token</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: The value provided in the request must match the <parameterReference>nonce</parameterReference> claim value that is returned in the <parameterReference>id_token</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: This nonce must be unique to a user session and difficult to guess, such as a GUID.
trans-unit.target: This nonce must be unique to a user session and difficult to guess, such as a GUID.

trans-unit.source: [Required] Indicates the encoding of the response.
trans-unit.target: [Required] Indicates the encoding of the response.

trans-unit.source: Supported values are <parameterReference>fragment</parameterReference> (URL fragment) and <parameterReference>form_post</parameterReference> (HTTP form POST).
trans-unit.target: Supported values are <parameterReference>fragment</parameterReference> (URL fragment) and <parameterReference>form_post</parameterReference> (HTTP form POST).

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>response_mode</parameterReference> parameter is required, because the current default response encoding is in a query parameter.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>response_mode</parameterReference> parameter is required, because the current default response encoding is in a query parameter.

trans-unit.source: This behavior is incompatible with the specification and the default value is likely to change.
trans-unit.target: This behavior is incompatible with the specification and the default value is likely to change.

trans-unit.source: To prevent your client from failing in the future, include the <parameterReference>response_mode</parameterReference> parameter in the request with a value of <parameterReference>fragment</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>form_post</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: To prevent your client from failing in the future, include the <parameterReference>response_mode</parameterReference> parameter in the request with a value of <parameterReference>fragment</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>form_post</parameterReference>.
